questions.question: What are you doing for New Year?
questions.answer: Going to Bullpot Farm in the Yorkshire Dales from December 30th to January 1st. We'll be back home on New Year's day.

answers.requirements: Coeliac - strictly no gluten/wheat/barley (even traces). Eats all meat and fish. Not a fan of sprouts.
Vegetarian, eats most things but not keen on meat substitutes.
Eats everything including gluten/wheat. Particularly loves clementines, satsumas, halloumi cheese and pasta.

questions.question: What are you likely to want to drink?

answers.requirements: Alcohol-free beer, particularly the blue-label ones from Aldi/Lidl (Perlenbacher or similar) as he'll likely be on driving duty
Strictly water or cow's milk only

questions.question: Can we stay over at your place?
questions.answer:
While we can't accommodate overnight guests in the house right now (James isn't sleeping through yet), we have a few options:

- There's a lovely Airbnb nearby that we highly recommend
- Our living room has a comfortable long sofa for one person
- The van is available (but note: no toilet, likely very cold, and parking isn't directly outside)

questions.question: We're coming to your house - what should we bring?
questions.answer:
We'll provide all the food and snacks - this lets us keep everything wheat-free without any stress.

While it's kind to offer to bring things, the most helpful contribution would be your time and energy! Things like:

- Helping with prep and cleanup
- Washing and drying up
- Baby changing
- Entertaining James
- General baby management

We enjoy catering and we'll make sure we're well supplied with food, snacks, desserts and drinks.

questions.question: We're coming over, can we bring Wine?
questions.answer: Jen has been described as a constipated alcoholic, and we have an extensive well stocked wine and spirits rack we're keen to make some progress through
